main_definition: The continuous transmission or broadcast of audio, video, or data over the internet without significant delay.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Real-time transfer of digital media content via the Internet
meanings_and_examples.example: Many people now prefer streaming movies and music rather than downloading files.

meanings_and_examples.definition: The act of watching or listening to content as it is being broadcasted online
meanings_and_examples.example: I was binge-watching a new series on Netflix through its streaming service.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Live broadcasting events, such as sports games and concerts over the internet without delays
meanings_and_examples.example: The NBA All-Star Game is available for viewers to watch live via an online streaming platform.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Process of releasing products or software updates continuously in small increments
meanings_and_examples.example: Apple often releases new versions of its iOS operating system through a continuous, daily-updated stream of smaller updates rather than infrequent major releases.

meanings_and_examples.definition: A method for delivering data to consumers over the internet
meanings_and_examples.example: The company adopted a streaming platform to distribute its digital content directly to customers' devices.
